en.help_window.title: Help
en.help_window.engine_guide.title: Engine Start Guide v2.2 (Full support for 4 engines)
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.overvie:
This help window consists of multiple tabs.
- **Engine Start Guide:** Basic startup methods and troubleshooting for each voice engine. (Current tab)
- **Voice Engine Descriptions:** More detailed explanations of each voice engine (features, cost, etc.).
- **Voice Catalog:** Search and check features and terms of use for available individual voice models (character voices, etc.). Data is managed in a JSON file and can be added/edited by users.
- **YouTube Live Setup:** Procedures for using comment reading on YouTube Live.
- **AI Theater Setup:** Procedures for using the AI Theater (skit creation) feature.
- **AI Chat Setup:** Procedures for using the AI interaction feature.
- **Settings Screen Guide:** Explanations for each item on the application settings screen.
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.google_: üöÄ „ÄêGoogle AI Studio New Voice„Äë - Added May 2025, Latest Technology

Setup: Just set the Google AI Studio API key (uses Gemini 2.5 Flash new voice feature)
Quality: Latest technology, real-time support, multilingual, high sound quality, emotion expression support
Features: Latest voice models like Alloy, Echo, Fable, Onyx, Nova, Shimmer, etc.
Advantages: Advanced expressive power and real-time performance. Always up-to-date via cloud.
Notes: API key required. Internet connection mandatory. Potential for usage-based billing.
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.avis_sp:
Startup: Launch AvisSpeech app OR docker run -p 10101:10101 aivisspeech/aivis-speech-engine (confirm image name)
Check: http://127.0.0.1:10101/docs (access via browser)
Features: High-quality Japanese voice synthesis. VOICEVOX compatible API. Emotion expression support.
Advantages: Locally executable and free. VOICEVOX characters may also be available.
Notes: Engine must be started beforehand. Consumes PC resources.
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.voicevo:
Startup: Launch VOICEVOX app OR docker run -p 50021:50021 voicevox/voicevox_engine
Check: http://127.0.0.1:50021/docs (access via browser)
Features: Abundant popular character voices like Zundamon, Shikoku Metan, etc.
Advantages: Locally executable and free. Diverse characters and styles. Active community.
Notes: Engine must be started beforehand. Consumes PC resources.
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.system_:
Setup: None (automatically uses standard TTS functions of Windows/macOS/Linux)
Features: Completely free, offline operation possible, high stability.
Advantages: Ready to use without additional installation. No internet connection required.
Notes: Sound quality and expressiveness are often inferior to the dedicated engines above. Available voices depend on the OS.
en.help_window.engine_guide.content.trouble:
- No sound:
    - Check the startup status and port settings of each engine.
    - Confirm that the correct audio output device is selected in the settings screen.
    - In character settings, ensure a valid voice model corresponding to the selected engine is chosen.
- API errors occur:
    - Verify that the Google AI Studio API key is correctly set.
    - Check your internet connection.
    - Ensure you have not reached the API usage limit.
- Others:
    - Check if any error messages appear in the application logs (main screen or console).
en.help_window.engine_description.google_ai:
Features: Latest AI technology, multilingual support, high quality, real-time, rich emotional expression.
Model Examples: Alloy (general purpose), Echo (energetic), Fable (storytelling), Onyx (deep voice), Nova (clear), Shimmer (bright), etc.
Gender Characteristics: Varies by model (e.g., AlloyÁî∑ÊÄß/Â•≥ÊÄßÈÅ∏ÊäûÂèØËÉΩ, Onyx„ÅØÊ∑±„Åø„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„ÇãÁî∑ÊÄßÂ£∞„Å™„Å©„ÄÅÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑ„Å™Ââ≤„ÇäÂΩì„Å¶„ÅØAPI‰ªïÊßò„Å´‰æùÂ≠ò).
Commercial Use: Subject to Google Cloud Platform terms of service. API key required, usage-based billing may apply. Check service specifications for credit notation.
Character Settings: No specific character settings, but a rich variety of voices.
en.help_window.engine_description.avis_spee:
Features: High-quality Japanese voice synthesis, VOICEVOX compatible API, emotion expression support.
Model Examples: Default voices (female/male, etc., varies by engine version). VOICEVOX models may also be available.
Gender Characteristics: Depends on the provided models (e.g., default calm female voice).
Commercial Use: Depends on the engine license. Often free for personal use, commercial use requires confirmation. If using VOICEVOX models, refer to their respective terms.
Character Settings: Since it's VOICEVOX compatible, VOICEVOX characters may be usable. In such cases, follow the character's terms of use.
Features: Diverse character voices, emotion style changes, accent adjustment.
Model Examples: Zundamon (childish cute voice), Shikoku Metan (cool girl voice), Kasukabe Tsumugi (bright girl voice), Amehare Hau (gentle older sister voice), Meian Himari (calm female voice), and many others.
Gender Characteristics: Set for each character (e.g., Zundamon has a feminine voice (officially a fairy), Shikoku Metan has a female voice).
Commercial Use: VOICEVOX core library is LGPL. Always check the terms of use for each character. Many allow personal/doujin commercial use with credit notation.
Character Settings: Detailed profiles, personalities, background stories, etc., are set for each character. Refer to the official website and related documents.
(Example: Zundamon - A fairy that transforms into Tohoku Zunko's weapon, the "Zunda Arrow". Characterized by ending sentences with "~noda".)
en.help_window.engine_description.system_tt:
Features: OS standard function, no additional installation required, offline operation possible.
Model Examples: Windows (e.g., Microsoft Haruka, Ayumi), macOS (e.g., Kyoko, Otoya), Linux (depends on backend like Festival, eSpeak).
Gender Characteristics: Varies by OS and installed voices (e.g., Haruka is a female voice, Kyoko is a female voice).
Commercial Use: Subject to OS license. Use within applications running on the OS is generally permitted, but distribution of generated audio, etc., requires confirmation.
Character Settings: Usually no specific character settings. General-purpose reading voices.
en.help_window.voice_catalog.details.title: Voice Model Details
en.help_window.youtube_live_setup.title: ## How to use comment reading on YouTube Live
en.help_window.youtube_live_setup.content:
Basic steps to use this application for YouTube Live comment reading.

**1. Required Software/Preparation:**
    - This application (Voice Bot Client)
    - OBS Studio (or other streaming software)
    - YouTube account and live streaming settings
    - (Recommended) Virtual audio device (e.g., VB-CABLE Virtual Audio Device, VoiceMeeter Banana)
        - Makes it easier to manage application audio and microphone audio separately in OBS.

**2. Application Settings:**
    - **Open the settings screen.**
    - **Select Voice Engine:** Choose the desired voice engine (Google AI, VOICEVOX, etc.) and set API keys or ports as needed.
    - **Select Character:** Choose the character or voice to use for reading.
    - **Audio Output Device:**
        - **Directly to OBS:** Select the input side of the virtual audio device (e.g., CABLE Input).
        - **Check on PC speakers while sending to OBS:** Configure routing with VoiceMeeter, etc., or output to PC speakers and capture desktop audio in OBS (note that other PC sounds will also be included).
    - **YouTube Live Integration:**
        - Open the "YouTube Live Integration" feature from the main screen or dedicated window.
        - **Enter Live ID:** Input the video ID of the ongoing YouTube Live stream (the string after `v=` in the URL).
        - **Start Connection:** Press the connect button to start fetching comments and reading them aloud.
        - (Optional) You may be able to set read targets (all, members only, etc.) or NG words.

**3. OBS Settings:**
    - **Add Audio Input Capture:**
        - Click the "+" button in Sources and select "Audio Input Capture."
        - Create a new source, name it (e.g., Voice Bot Audio), and click OK.
        - **Device:** Select the output side of the virtual audio device set as the application's audio output (e.g., CABLE Output).
        - This will bring the application's read-aloud audio into OBS.
    - **Microphone Settings:** Add your microphone device to OBS as usual.
    - **Volume Adjustment:** Adjust the balance of voice bot audio, microphone audio, game audio, etc., in the OBS audio mixer.

**4. Test and Start Streaming:**
    - Start a test stream on YouTube Live (e.g., unlisted).
    - Post a comment to check if the application reads it and it's broadcast via OBS.
    - Adjust volume, reading speed, etc., as needed.
    - If there are no issues, start the actual stream.

**Points:**
    - **Delay:** There will be some delay from comment fetching to reading aloud.
    - **API Limits:** Engines using APIs like Google AI Studio may have usage limits. Be mindful during long streams.
    - **CPU Load:** Local engines (VOICEVOX, etc.) consume PC resources. Be aware of your streaming PC's specs.
en.help_window.ai_theater_setup.title: ## How to use as AI Theater
en.help_window.ai_theater_setup.content:
Basic steps to create and run an AI theater with character interactions using this application.

**1. Concept and Scenario Creation:**
    - **Decide Theme:** Determine the theme for your story or conversation (e.g., daily comedy, sci-fi, fantasy skit).
    - **Set Characters:**
        - Prepare the characters you want to feature using the application's character management function.
        - Set the voice engine, voice, speaking style, etc., for each character.
    - **Create Scenario:**
        - Write the script using a text editor or dedicated tool.
        - Typically, write the character's name before their line (e.g., `Character A: Hello!`).
        - Add stage directions (situation descriptions, action instructions) as needed.
        - (Optional) Some applications allow including tags in lines to control emotions or voice tone (e.g., `Character B: (angry)I don't care anymore!`).

**2. Application Settings:**
    - **Open the AI Theater window.** (If a dedicated window exists)
    - **Character Assignment:** Link character names in the scenario to characters set in the application.
    - **Load Scenario:** Load the created scenario file (check supported formats like .txt, .csv).
        - For CSV format, check and set column definitions (character column, line column, etc.).
    - **Display Settings:**
        - If character portraits or background images can be set, configure them accordingly.
        - Adjust font size, color, display speed, etc.

**3. Execution and Adjustment:**
    - **Start Playback:** Begin scenario playback. Characters will read their lines sequentially.
    - **Timing Adjustment:** Check if the pauses between lines and reading speed are appropriate. Modify the scenario or settings if necessary.
    - **Check Presentation:** Verify that portrait changes and background changes occur as intended.
    - (Optional) If recording/streaming with OBS, set it to capture the AI Theater window.

**4. Advanced Use:**
    - **Branching Scenarios:** Some advanced AI theater tools offer scenario branching based on choices or random line generation features.
    - **External Integration:** Integration to play lines in response to specific events (e.g., comments during a stream) is also possible.

**Points:**
    - **Character Voice Individuality:** Clearly setting each character's voice quality and speaking style enhances the play's appeal.
    - **Importance of Pauses:** "Pauses" are crucial in conversational plays. Adding appropriate pauses creates more natural interactions.
    - **Check Scenario Format:** Confirm the scenario format supported by your application (e.g., tag usability) beforehand.
en.help_window.ai_chat_setup.title: ## How to use as AI Chatbot
en.help_window.ai_chat_setup.content:
Basic steps to use this application as an AI chatbot (interactive AI).

**1. Clarify Purpose:**
    - Define how you want to use the AI chatbot (e.g., casual conversation partner, specific information responder, role-playing).
    - This will affect character settings and response generation methods.

**2. Application Settings:**
    - **Open the AI Chat window.** (If a dedicated window exists)
    - **Select/Set Character:**
        - Choose the AI character for the chat.
        - Set the voice engine, voice, speaking style (first person, sentence endings, etc.).
        - (Optional) Detailed character personality and background settings can lead to more consistent responses (e.g., prompt engineering).
    - **Select Response Generation Engine:**
        - **Local LLM:** Use a small language model running on your PC (often requires separate setup).
        - **External API:** Use large language model APIs like OpenAI (ChatGPT), Google (Gemini), Anthropic (Claude).
            - API key setup is required.
            - Usage-based billing may apply.
    - **Prompt Settings (Important):**
        - Set "system prompts" or "pre-instructions" to direct the AI chatbot's behavior.
        - Example: "You are a friendly cat character. Your first person is 'Wagahai' and you end sentences with '~nya.'"
        - Significantly impacts response quality and consistency. Adjust through trial and error.
    - **Voice Recognition Settings (Input):**
        - If enabling voice input from a microphone, select the microphone device.
        - Set voice recognition accuracy and language.
    - **Voice Synthesis Settings (Output):**
        - Confirm which voice will be used for AI responses (the voice specified in character settings).

**3. Start and Operate Chat:**
    - **Input Methods:**
        - **Text Input:** Enter messages in the text box and send.
        - **Voice Input:** Speak into the microphone; voice-recognized text will be input.
    - **AI Response:** The AI generates a response, which is read aloud in the character's voice. Text is also displayed.
    - **Continue Conversation:** Repeat the above to continue the conversation.
    - **Conversation History:** Past interactions are displayed, and responses are usually context-based.
    - (Optional) There may be features like clearing conversation history.

**4. Advanced Use and Notes:**
    - **Role-Playing:** Enjoy conversations by role-playing as a specific character.
    - **Information Retrieval:** If using an external LLM API, you can ask about current information or specialized knowledge (however, always verify information accuracy).
    - **API Usage Fees:** When using external LLM APIs, costs are incurred based on token count (similar to processed character count). Be cautious with long usage or large text processing.
    - **Hallucinations:** AI can generate factually incorrect information or plausible-sounding falsehoods (hallucinations). Always verify important information.
    - **Privacy:** When inputting personal or confidential information into an AI chatbot, understand how that information is handled (especially with external APIs) and be cautious.
en.help_window.settings_guide.intro:
This screen allows you to configure various settings related to the application's behavior.
After making changes, press the "Save Settings" button in the bottom right to save your changes.
en.help_window.settings_guide.api.title: ‚öôÔ∏è API Settings
en.help_window.settings_guide.api.content:
- **Google AI Studio API Key:** Key required to use Google's latest voice synthesis models (Gemini voice, etc.). Enter the API key obtained from Google AI Studio. The "Test" button can verify connection and voice generation.
- **YouTube API Key:** Key required to fetch YouTube Live comments. Enable YouTube Data API v3 in Google Cloud Console, obtain an API key, and enter it. The "Test" button can verify the API key's validity.
- **Text Generation Model:** Select the Large Language Model (LLM) used for AI chat features, etc.
    - `LM Studio (Local)`: Uses a model running on LM Studio on your local PC. Selecting this displays an input field for the endpoint URL.
    - `gemini- ...`: Uses Google's Gemini model. Performance and cost vary by model. API key must be set.
- **LM Studio Endpoint URL:** If `LM Studio (Local)` is selected above, enter the URL of the server provided by LM Studio (e.g., `http://127.0.0.1:1234/v1/chat/completions`).
en.help_window.settings_guide.ai_chat.title: üí¨ AI Chat Settings
en.help_window.settings_guide.ai_chat.conte:
- **AI Chat Processing Mode:** Selects the timing of user voice input and AI response processing during AI chat.
    - `sequential (Recommended)`: The AI generates and speaks its response after the user's voice has played. This mode is closer to a natural conversation flow.
    - `parallel`: User voice playback and AI response processing occur concurrently. Responses may be faster, but conversations might overlap.
- **Default Voice Engine:** Select the voice synthesis engine to be used by default throughout the application. Individual engine settings are also possible per character.
    - `google_ai_studio_new`: Google AI Studio's latest voice synthesis. High quality and multilingual. Requires API key and internet connection.
    - `avis_speech`: Avis Speech Engine. Runs locally. Requires the engine to be started beforehand.
    - `voicevox`: VOICEVOX Engine. Runs locally. Diverse character voices. Requires the engine to be started beforehand.
    - `system_tts`: OS standard text-to-speech. Usable immediately without extra setup, but quality may be inferior to dedicated engines.
- **Audio Output Device:** Select the audio device (speakers, headphones, etc.) for voice playback.
- **Enable Fallback/Order:** Whether to use an alternative engine if the main voice engine fails (Enable), and the priority order for fallback (Automatic, Prioritize Quality, etc.).
en.help_window.settings_guide.system.title: üõ†Ô∏è System Settings
en.help_window.settings_guide.system.conten:
- **Auto Save:** Whether to automatically save settings upon change. If unchecked, changes are not saved until the "Save Settings" button is pressed.
- **Debug Mode:** Enables developer-oriented debug features, such as outputting detailed application logs.
- **Conversation History Length:** Sets the number of conversation history items to remember for AI chat and YouTube Live comment reading. 0 for no history. Larger values may improve context understanding but also increase resource consumption.
en.help_window.settings_guide.buttons.title: üíæ Settings Management Buttons
en.help_window.settings_guide.buttons.conte:
- **Save Settings:** Saves the current settings on the GUI to a file.
- **Reset Settings:** Resets system settings (API keys, engine selection, etc.) to their initial state. Character settings are not reset.
- **Export Settings:** Writes the current system settings to a JSON file. Useful for backups or migrating to other environments.
- **Import Settings:** Reads system settings from an exported JSON file.
The settings screen also has an "Advanced Features" tab. It provides the following features (some are planned for implementation):
- **Performance Monitoring:** Feature to monitor application CPU usage, memory usage, etc. (To be implemented).
- **Backup/Restore:** Feature to back up all application settings (system settings + character data) to a single file and restore from it.
- **Plugin Management:** Management screen for adding external plugins to extend functionality (To be implemented).
